revision.comment: Created page with "Possibly: The eight volumes of letters writ by a Turkish spy, who lived five and forty years, undiscover'd, At Paris: Giving an Impartial Account to the Divan, at Constantin..."
revision.text: Possibly: The eight volumes of letters writ by a Turkish spy, who lived five and forty years, undiscover'd, At Paris: Giving an Impartial Account to the Divan, at Constantinople, of the most Remarkable Transactions of Europe; And Discovering several Intrigues and Secrets of the Christian Courts (especially of that of France) from the Year 1637, to the Year 1682. Written originally in Arabick, translated into Italian, from thence into English. And now Published with a Large Historical Preface and Index to Illustrate the Whole. By the Translator of the First Volume. (Giovanni Paolo Marana). 8v. (London : Printed for J. Rhodes, D. Brown, R. Sare, B. and S. Tooke, G. Strahan, W. Mears, S. Ballard, and F. Clay, 1723). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2435634~S1
